trans-unit.source: The Ratings report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see the distribution of how customers rate your app in the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: The Ratings report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see the distribution of how customers rate your app in the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: Ratings report
trans-unit.target: Ratings report

trans-unit.source: Ratings report
trans-unit.target: Ratings report

trans-unit.source: The **Ratings** report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see the distribution of how customers rate your app in the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: The **Ratings** report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see the distribution of how customers rate your app in the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: You can view this data in your dashboard, or [download the report](download-analytic-reports.md) to view offline.
trans-unit.target: You can view this data in your dashboard, or [download the report](download-analytic-reports.md) to view offline.

trans-unit.source: In this report, a rating means the number of stars (from 1 to 5) that a customer gave your app when rating it in the Store.
trans-unit.target: In this report, a rating means the number of stars (from 1 to 5) that a customer gave your app when rating it in the Store.

trans-unit.source: The **Ratings** report does not include info on any individual comments left as reviews; those are available in the [Reviews report](reviews-report.md).
trans-unit.target: The **Ratings** report does not include info on any individual comments left as reviews; those are available in the [Reviews report](reviews-report.md).

trans-unit.source: Apply filters
trans-unit.target: Apply filters

trans-unit.source: Near the top of the page, you can expand **Apply filters** to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by market.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of the page, you can expand **Apply filters** to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by market.

trans-unit.source: **Date**: The default filter is **Last 30 days**, but you can expand this up to **Last 12 months**.
trans-unit.target: **Date**: The default filter is **Last 30 days**, but you can expand this up to **Last 12 months**.

trans-unit.source: **Market**: The default filter is **All markets**.
trans-unit.target: **Market**: The default filter is **All markets**.

trans-unit.source: You can choose a specific market if you want this page to only show ratings from customers in that market.
trans-unit.target: You can choose a specific market if you want this page to only show ratings from customers in that market.

trans-unit.source: **Device type**: The default filter is **All devices**.
trans-unit.target: **Device type**: The default filter is **All devices**.

trans-unit.source: You can choose a specific device type if you want this page to only show ratings left by customers using that type of device.
trans-unit.target: You can choose a specific device type if you want this page to only show ratings left by customers using that type of device.

trans-unit.source: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section, and will reflect any other filters you've chosen here.
trans-unit.target: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section, and will reflect any other filters you've chosen here.

trans-unit.source: Average rating
trans-unit.target: Average rating

trans-unit.source: The **Average rating** chart shows the average rating of your app over the selected period of time.
trans-unit.target: The **Average rating** chart shows the average rating of your app over the selected period of time.

trans-unit.source: Number of ratings
trans-unit.target: Number of ratings

trans-unit.source: The **Number of ratings** chart shows the total number of ratings of your app over the selected period of time.
trans-unit.target: The **Number of ratings** chart shows the total number of ratings of your app over the selected period of time.

trans-unit.source: New and revised ratings
trans-unit.target: New and revised ratings

trans-unit.source: The **New and revised ratings** chart shows the number of ratings for each type of rating (new or revised) over the selected period of time.
trans-unit.target: The **New and revised ratings** chart shows the number of ratings for each type of rating (new or revised) over the selected period of time.

trans-unit.source: **New ratings** are ratings that customers have submitted but haven't changed.
trans-unit.target: **New ratings** are ratings that customers have submitted but haven't changed.

trans-unit.source: **Revised ratings** are ratings that have been changed by the customer.
trans-unit.target: **Revised ratings** are ratings that have been changed by the customer.

trans-unit.source: **Note** A rating will appear here as revised even if the customer only changed or added the text or title of their review and left the actual rating the same.
trans-unit.target: **Note** A rating will appear here as revised even if the customer only changed or added the text or title of their review and left the actual rating the same.

trans-unit.source: Average rating over time
trans-unit.target: Average rating over time

trans-unit.source: The **Average rating over time** chart shows how the app's average rating has changed over the selected period of time.
trans-unit.target: The **Average rating over time** chart shows how the app's average rating has changed over the selected period of time.

trans-unit.source: Rather than calculating the average of all ratings left during the selected period of time (as in the **Average rating** chart), the **Average rating over time** chart shows you how customers rated the app on a given day or week during the period.
trans-unit.target: Rather than calculating the average of all ratings left during the selected period of time (as in the **Average rating** chart), the **Average rating over time** chart shows you how customers rated the app on a given day or week during the period.

trans-unit.source: This helps you identify trends or determine if ratings were affected by updates or other factors.
trans-unit.target: This helps you identify trends or determine if ratings were affected by updates or other factors.

trans-unit.source: If you have filtered the info by **Last 30 days** or **Last 3 months**, the chart displays your average rating by day.
trans-unit.target: If you have filtered the info by **Last 30 days** or **Last 3 months**, the chart displays your average rating by day.

trans-unit.source: If you've filtered by **Last 6 months** or **Last 12 months**, the chart displays your average rating by week (with a new week considered to start on Monday; the average rating shown is for the previous week).
trans-unit.target: If you've filtered by **Last 6 months** or **Last 12 months**, the chart displays your average rating by week (with a new week considered to start on Monday; the average rating shown is for the previous week).

trans-unit.source: Markets
trans-unit.target: Markets

trans-unit.source: The **Markets** chart shows average rating and number of ratings over the selected period of time by market.
trans-unit.target: The **Markets** chart shows average rating and number of ratings over the selected period of time by market.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you have used the **Page filters** to specify a specific market, you won't see this chart on the **Ratings** report.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you have used the **Page filters** to specify a specific market, you won't see this chart on the **Ratings** report.

trans-unit.source: To see this chart, change the **Page filters** to show all markets.
trans-unit.target: To see this chart, change the **Page filters** to show all markets.

trans-unit.source: By default, we show you the market which had the most reviews and continue downward from there, but you can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the **Number of ratings** column of this chart.
trans-unit.target: By default, we show you the market which had the most reviews and continue downward from there, but you can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the **Number of ratings** column of this chart.

trans-unit.source: You can also sort the data by **Average rating** or **Market** by clicking those columns.
trans-unit.target: You can also sort the data by **Average rating** or **Market** by clicking those columns.

trans-unit.source: **Note** It’s likely that you’ll see a different number of ratings when comparing the **Ratings** report in the Windows Dev Center with the Reviews report in the older Dev Center mobile app.
trans-unit.target: **Note** It’s likely that you’ll see a different number of ratings when comparing the **Ratings** report in the Windows Dev Center with the Reviews report in the older Dev Center mobile app.

trans-unit.source: This is because the app only shows data for reviews left from customers on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier.
trans-unit.target: This is because the app only shows data for reviews left from customers on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier.

trans-unit.source: This may also be a result of work by Microsoft to remove reviews from the Windows Store that have been identified as spam, inappropriate, offensive or have other policy violations.
trans-unit.target: This may also be a result of work by Microsoft to remove reviews from the Windows Store that have been identified as spam, inappropriate, offensive or have other policy violations.

trans-unit.source: We expect this action will result in a better customer experience.
trans-unit.target: We expect this action will result in a better customer experience.
